react.label: React
react.description: A JavaScript library for building fast, interactive user interfaces.

java.label: Java
java.description: A high-level, class-based programming language used for building cross-platform applications.

javafx.label: JavaFX
javafx.description: A Java library for building rich client desktop applications with modern UIs.

typescript.label: TypeScript
typescript.description: A superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language.

javascript.label: Javascript
javascript.description: The programming language of the Web, used for building dynamic websites and applications.

nodejs.label: Node.js
nodejs.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine for building fast, scalable server applications.

express.label: Express.js
express.description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework for building APIs and web apps.

mongodb.label: MongoDB
mongodb.description: A NoSQL document database designed for high scalability and flexibility.

postgresql.label: PostgreSQL
postgresql.description: An open-source relational database system known for its reliability and advanced features.

sqlserver.label: SQL Server
sqlserver.description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft, used in enterprise environments.

powerapps.label: Microsoft Power Apps
powerapps.description: A Microsoft service for building low-code custom applications quickly and easily.

electron.label: Electron.js
electron.description: A framework for building cross-platform desktop apps using web technologies like JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

mui.label: Material UI
mui.description: A popular React UI framework offering prebuilt, customizable components based on Material Design.

python.label: Python
python.description: A high-level programming language known for its readability and vast ecosystem for web, data, and automation.
